result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Vincent Yakich Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: concurrent to Count #2, concurrent to case# 14CF3638, concurrent to case# 14CM3028, and concurrent to case# 14CM2253.  Credit given for 92 days time served.

(Assessed in case # 14CF3638):  As to the uncharged read-ins:  PAY restitution in the amount of $2,157.41 payable to Walmart.  PAY restitution in the amount of $729.80 payable to Menard's.  PAY restitution in the amount of $60.00 payable to Pick-N-Save.  PAY restitution in the amount of $65.50 payable to Family Dollar.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge. PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.

concurrent to Count #1, concurrent to case# 14CF3638, concurrent to case# 14CM3028, and concurrent to case# 14CM2253. 
Credit given for 92 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Vincent Yakich Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING Transcript (43 pages) commencing 07-16-2015 received and filed. CH
Denying Motion for Sentence Credit, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Conen, Br. 30, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.

Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 (MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION concurrent to Count #2, concurrent to case# 14CF3638, concurrent to case# 14CM3028, and concurrent to case# 14CM2253.  
Credit given for 92 days time served.

AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 54 MONTHS, concurrent to Count #1, concurrent to case# 14CF3638, concurrent to case# 14CM3028, and concurrent to case# 14CM2253.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS.
Credit given for 92 days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program, IF DEEMED APPROPRIATE BY WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION (AS TO COUNT 2):  
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges. The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* As to case# 14CF3638:  PAY restitution in the amount of $1001.09 payable to Walmart.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* As to case# 14CM2253:  PAY restitution in the amount of $296.88 payable to Pick-N-Save.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* As to the uncharged read-ins:  PAY restitution in the amount of $2,157.41 payable to Walmart.  PAY restitution in the amount of $729.80 payable to Menard's.  PAY restitution in the amount of $60.00 payable to Pick-N-Save.  PAY restitution in the amount of $65.50 payable to Family Dollar.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 (MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
to Judge Donald; from defendant's mother - filed.

Defendant Steven V Yakich in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven V Yakich in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court addressed bail:  Arguments heard.  Court ordered bail to remain as a $750.00 signature bond with TURNOVER TO: Justice Point Pretrial Services to continue.  Conditions of release remain as previously ordered.

Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing Hearing on 07-16-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Eric M. Vega in court, defendant Steven V Yakich not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request to adjourn the 06-05-2015 at 8:30 AM Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 07-16-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
(1) Defendant's Character Witness Letter from defendant's mother; filed.

Defendant, Steven V Yakich, NOT in court; in custody.  Attorney Darryl Smith appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-05-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in custody.  Ronald Dague for Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY PICK N' SAVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Steven Vincent Yakich in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
